docTitle.titlePart:
skriva uppa fórisk, eav oinun fóriskun Manne, vi Navne: Heanus Heanussoon,
sum ee
y hansara Aldirdoume heave fingje fra honun, tou ead han hevur skatera Bougjena oumisselia, qvearfire ee maa sia honun:
Meanga Tak!
H. D. Matras.

msItem.title: Foreword
msItem.incipit: Tan Meavur sum hesa Boug hevur skriva o ot
msItem.explicit: tuui tea sum tu itkje voidst, kan ongjin kreavja eav tear
msItem.colophon:
Hattarvuig tan 26de Marts 1854
H. D. Matras

msItem.title: Kong Christians Rim
msItem.incipit: Her gaar dants paa Christians borg

supportDesc.extent:
iii + 203 + i 330-335 210-215
Fol. 150 written on smaller, reused paper measuring 320 195

foliation.p: Paginated 1-404 in ink on every leaf.
Every tenth leaf (except fol. 20r) is foliated in pencil in the bottom left corner.

collation.catchwords: Most pages (both recto and verso) have catchwords of the following verse number.

condition.p: The paper is weak at the edges.
Many pages are in poor condition, e.g. fols. 68-69.
Many pages have been repaired, e.g. fols. 91, 108, 112-114.

layout.p: Written in a single column (two lines of verse per line in the manuscript) with 40 to 60 lines per page.
The lines of verse are written in an area measuring 310-315 175-185 . Verse numbers are written in the right margin.

handNote.p: The majority of the manuscript was written by Hans Hansen.
The additions on ff. 1r-4v (foreword), ff. 199r-200r (index) and 33r (end of item 92) were written by Hans David Matras, who also paginated the manuscript.
Items 3-4 (ff. 17r-17v) were written by Johannes Clemensen.

decoDesc.p: A drawing of two figures dancing the ballads can be found on the bottom of 120r.

additions.p: On fol. 150v the main scribe has added the following: Denne qvade bog ere ud dragen af gamle bedrifter som har spaseret om al verden og ere nu heer at finde i denne bog til at qvade paa færöisk med Riim og om noder Efter som en hver nu vel kan det behage at dansa let men springa Tet.
On the back pastedown the note Ívar av Bretlandi til v. 99 is written in pencil.

origin.p: The manuscript was compiled by Hans Dávur Hansen. A dedication poem on 4r (p. 7) reads Bougjin siur so fire see! | Heanus Heanuson gjórde mee! | Heanus Daavur kom ee fraa! | han buir tat vi Kjedlingaa=aae!

provenance.p: The manuscript was sent by Hans David Matras to V. U. Hammershaimb in or after 1854. On 4v (p. 8) Matras has written the initials S.T. followed by Tiil tan veallarda hógtearaja Cand: theol: V. U. Hammershaimb.

listBibl.bibl: Chesnutt and Larsen: The Manuscripts of Faroese Ballads VII 57-61
